title: Tom Curry and Sam Underhill's back row partnership matures again with dominant showing against Australia
text:
Tom Curry and Sam Underhill had been hailed as the Kamikaze kids by England head coach Eddie Jones during the summer warm-up matches because of their desire to “hit everything that moves”.

On Saturday at the Oita Stadium, pitted against two of the finest proponents of back row play the game has ever seen, the kids became men.

The pair delivered the kind of lung-busting display, equal in its ferocious work-rate and physical relentlessness, true to the brilliant instincts of legendary duo Richard Hill and Neil Back, who were both critical to England’s World Cup triumph in 2003.

Curry was the official man of the match but it could easily have been given to Underhill, so central were the pair...
description: Tom Curry and Sam Underhill had been hailed as the Kamikaze kids by England head coach Eddie Jones during the summer warm-up matches because of their desire to “hit everything that moves”.
